list_definition.definition: (a piece of) woven material from which clothes and many other items are made

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: Woollen cloth is often more expensive than other cloths.

list_ex_of_english: I have already provided for the manufacture of utility ready-made and made-to-measure overcoats from cloths weighing up to 22 ozs.
They consist mainly of cotton and woollen cloths, duck and canvas, narrow fabrics, and machine thread.
The clothing industry requirement for cheap suits and cloths contributes largely to its inefficiency.
In the glossary there should be provided standards for all the cloths we know that can be given standards.
I refer in particular to firms manufacturing industrial cloths.
Although supplies for the home market improved during 1949, production of these cloths is still substantially below the pre-war level.
Sheets and pillow cases are not subject to coupon; the only essential rationed household goods are towels and tea cloths.
Special attention is being given to the provision of cloths suitable for baby garments.
